dct:description: NLCD tree canopy cover is a 30 m raster geospatial dataset that is available for the conterminous United States. They are generated by the USDA Forest Service. These data contain percent tree canopy estimates, as a continuous variable, for each pixel across all land covers and types. Tree canopy cover is derived from multi-spectral satellite imagery and other available ground and ancillary information.

#########
# GDSC ETL is performed in two steps: shell script to ETL data into postgres
# and then additional transformations with SQL in postGIS (if needed).
####

#########
# Step 1 - bash script (pseudo code)
####

# create directory structure and move into it
mkdir -p /data/us_2021_nlcd_tcc_v4/{download,etl} && cd /data/us_2021_nlcd_tcc_v4

# set update flag based on last update and update frequency
do_update=0 if date() < last_update + update_frequency else do_update = 1

# download if update flag is set:
if do_update == 1 then
  wget -O download/us_2021_nlcd_tcc_v4.zip 'https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/mrlc/nlcd_tcc_CONUS_2021_v2021-4.zip'

# unzip to download directory if update flag is set
if do_update == 1 then
  unzip -d download download/us_2021_nlcd_tcc_v4.zip && rm download/us_2021_nlcd_tcc_v4.zip

# load raster into postGIS with:
    raster2pgsql -s 5070 -d -C -I nlcd_tcc_conus_2021_v2021-4.tif -F -t 256x256 us_2021_nlcd_tcc_v4 > load_raster.sql
psql <connection options> < load_raster.sql
rm load_raster.sql
